(2 comments)
Please retain the actual type const_zstring.
Done
I couldn't see a ClientIdentifier field in DHCPv6 section here: https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/systemd.network.html
Done
Couldn't find "SendHostname" under DHCPv6 section
Done

Can use already available "string_umap" (defined in util file) like the below?
```
string_umap<std::unique_ptr<dhcp::Configuration>> dhcpConfigs;
```
Done

This commit also moves it to the interface level from the system level.
Please mention that as well in the commit message.
Done
Please mention what is the issue with this current implementation. Like - the changes done for the IPv4 setting impacts the IPv6 settings and gets applied to both interfaces.
Done
Configure DHCPv4 and DHCPv6 parameters independently ?
Updated
@Johnathan, we believe IPMI will be impacted with this change. Could you please provide your thoughts?

I think we dont need this function 
can copy those two lines here
Done

Can you get me the use case where we have DHCP client configuration would be dependent on the interface? I feel it should be system wide same. However I am in agreement that we should have the dhcpv4 and dhcpv6 configuration as a separate object. 

NOTE: Also make sure that there should not be any regressions:
- bmcweb
- IPMI
- openbmc-test-automation.
Comments.

As its possible for the interfaces to be on different subnets/networks, we think it should be possible configure these dhcp parameters independently.

bmcweb : we are working on the changes in bmcweb in this commit, https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/63390

IPMI : We're waiting to hear from Jonathan Mantey on this, as we're unable to asses the impact on IPMI.

openbmc-test-automation : We're discussing with the stake holders on this.

Is there some compelling reason for changing the name of the class?
If there isn't a strong argument for doing so I prefer it not be changed.
As we're moving the dhcp objects from Network Manager level to Ethernet interface level, we have updated the parent object of dhcp configuration to EthernetInterface from Manager.

Is this the correct location to change these?
The IPv6AcceptRa section also has these two entries.
Does the value in DHCPv6 override IPv6AcceptRA?
These parameters were part of the DHCP section of the network configuration only.
